00017 package WeBWorK::DB::Schema;
00018 
00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 WeBWorK::DB::Schema - schema superclass (to hold documentation)
00022 
00023 =head1 SYNOPSIS
00024 
00025 FIXME: write synopsis
00026 
00027 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00028 
00029 FIXME: write description
00030 
00031 =head2 Record Identifiers and Keys
00032 
00033 Several of the tables used in the WeBWorK database have records that are
00034 identified by the values of a set of fields, rather than by the value of a
00035 single field. Because of this, when identifying a record (in calls to the
00036 C<list>, C<exists>, C<get>, and C<delete> methods), one must specify a list of
00037 values rather than a single value. This is represented in the documentation for
00038 these methods by the expression C<@keyparts>. The values in C<@keyparts>
00039 correspond to the fields returned by the C<KEYFIELDS> method of the table's
00040 record class. If an element of C<@keyparts> is undefined, then the
00041 corresponding field is not used in the match. Some methods require all elements
00042 of C<@keyparts> to be defined. This is noted below.
00043 
00044 A "record key", as in the C<list> method, is a reference to a list containing
00045 values which correspond to the the fields returned by the C<KEYFIELDS> method
00046 of the table's record class.
00047 
00048 =cut
00049 
00050 use strict;
00051 use warnings;
00052

00065 ################################################################################
00066 # constructor
00067 ################################################################################
00068 
00069 =head1 CONSTRUCTOR
00070 
00071 =over
00072 
00073 =item new($db, $driver, $table, $record, $params)
00074 
00075 Creates a schema interface for C<$table>, using the driver interface provided
00076 by C<$driver> and using the record class named in C<$record>. If the C<$driver>
00077 does not support the driver style needed by the schema, an exception is thrown.
00078 C<$params> contains extra information needed by the schema and is schema
00079 dependent. C<$db> is provided so that schemas can query other schemas.
00080 
00081 =back
00082 
00083 =cut
00084 
00085 sub new {
00086     my ($proto, $db, $driver, $table, $record, $params) = @_;
00087     my $class = ref($proto) || $proto;
00088     
00089     my @supportedTables = $proto->TABLES();
00090     die "unsupported table (schema supports: @supportedTables)"
00091         unless grep { $_ eq "*" or $_ eq $table } @supportedTables;
00092     
00093     my ($driverStyle, $schemaStyle) = ($driver->STYLE(), $proto->STYLE());
00094     die "schema/driver style mismatch (driver provides $driverStyle, schema requires $schemaStyle)"
00095         unless $driverStyle eq $schemaStyle;
00096     
00097     my $self = {
00098         db     => $db,
00099         driver => $driver,
00100         table  => $table,
00101         record => $record,
00102         params => $params,
00103     };
00104     bless $self, $class;
00105     return $self;
00106 }
00107 
00108 =head1 TABLE ACCESS METHODS
00109 
00110 =over
00111 
00112 =item count(@keyparts)
00113 
00114 Returns the number of records matching @keyparts is found in the table.
00115 
00116 =item list(@keyparts)
00117 
00118 Returns a list containing the key of each record in the table that matches the
00119 values in C<@keyparts>. Elements of C<@keyparts> may be undefined.
00120 
00121 =item exists(@keyparts)
00122 
00123 Returns a boolean value representing whether one or more records that match the
00124 values in C<@keyparts> exist in the table. Elements of C<@keyparts> may be
00125 undefined.
00126 
00127 =item add($Record)
00128 
00129 Attempts to add C<$Record> to the table. C<$Record> must be an instance of the
00130 table's record class. Returns true on success and false on failure (for
00131 example, if the database couldn't be contacted). If a record with the same key
00132 exists, an exception is thrown.
00133 
00134 =item get(@keyparts)
00135 
00136 Attempts to retrieve the record matching C<@keyparts> from the table. Returns
00137 an instance of the table's record class if there is a match. Returns undef if
00138 no record matches. All elements of C<@keyparts> must be defined.
00139 
00140 =item gets(@keypartsRefs)
00141 
00142 Returns a list of records matching the keyparts refered to in each element of
00143 C<@keypartsRef>. Each element of the returned list will contain either a record
00144 object (if there was a match) or the value C<undef> (if there was no match). All
00145 elements of C<@keyparts> must be defined.
00146 
00147 =item put($Record)
00148 
00149 Attempts to replace the record in the table that matches the key of $Record.
00150 Returns true on success and false on failure (for example, if the database
00151 couldn't be contacted). If no such record exists, an exception is thrown.
00152 
00153 =item delete(@keyparts)
00154 
00155 Attempts to delete the record or records in the table that match C<@keyparts>.
00156 Returns true if the record(s) was successfully deleted or did not exist, and
00157 false if deletion failed. Elements of C<@keyparts> may be undefined.
00158 
00159 =back
00160 
00161 =cut
00162 
00163 1;
